text: The 1978-1979 season was the 106th season of competitive football in Scotland and the 82nd season of Scottish league football. ==Scottish Premier Division== Champions: Celtic Relegated: Hearts, Motherwell ==Scottish League Division One== Promoted: Dundee, Kilmarnock Relegated: Montrose, Queen of the South ==Scottish League Division Two== Promoted: Berwick Rangers, Dunfermline Athletic ==Cup honours== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !width=140|Competition !width=135|Winner !width=95|Score !width=135|Runner-up |- |align=left|Scottish Cup 1978–79 |Rangers |3 – 2 (2nd rep.) |Hibernian |- |align=left|League Cup 1978–79 |Rangers |2 – 1 |Aberdeen |- |align=left|Junior Cup |Cumnock Juniors |1 – 0 |Bo'ness United |} ==Other Honours== ===National=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !width=160|Competition !width=135|Winner !width=80|Score !width=135|Runner-up |- |align=left|Scottish Qualifying Cup - North |Brora Rangers |5 – 0 |Peterhead |- |align=left|Scottish Qualifying Cup - South |Spartans |2 – 0 * |Coldstream |} ===County=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !width=160|Competition !width=135|Winner !width=80|Score !width=135|Runner-up |- |align=left|Aberdeenshire Cup |Peterhead | | |- |align=left|Ayrshire Cup |Kilmarnock |4 – 0 |Girvan |- |align=left|Fife Cup |East Fife |2 – 2 * |Raith Rovers |- |align=left|Forfarshire Cup |Forfar Athletic |3 – 1 |Dundee |- |align=left|Glasgow Cup |Rangers |3 – 1 |Celtic |- |align=left|Renfrewshire Cup |St Mirren |10 – 1 * |Morton |- |align=left|Stirlingshire Cup |Clydebank |1 – 0 |Dumbarton |} \- aggregate over two legs \- replay \- won on penalties ===Highland League=== ==Individual honours== {| class="wikitable" |- ! width=170|Award ! width=150|Winner ! width=140|Club |- | Footballer of the Year || Andy Ritchie || Morton |- |Players' Player of the Year || Paul Hegarty || Dundee United |- |Young Player of the Year || Ray Stewart || Dundee United |} ==Scotland national team== {| class="wikitable" !Date !Venue !Opponents ! title: 1978–79 in Scottish football
